alert.note: Alert for Baxter; Boone; Johnson; Marion; Newton (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 13 at 10:53AM CDT until April 13 at 1:55PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Baxter County in north central Arkansas... Boone County in north central Arkansas... Marion County in north central Arkansas... Central Newton County in north central Arkansas... Northwestern Johnson County in western Arkansas... * Until 155 PM CDT. * At 1053 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Harrison, Bull Shoals, Yellville, Jasper, Flippin, Lakeview in Baxter County, Diamond City, Bergman, Western Grove, Lead Hill, Pyatt, Valley Springs, Omaha, Arkawana, Dugger, Olvey, Crawford, Capps, Myrtle and Pruitt. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
